data.title: Fees to encourage sorting of rubbish
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) is expected to renew garbage collection fees next June as part of its efforts to encourage people to sort their household waste.

data.title: Prawit confidant refutes iCon rumours
data.description: Gen Vitch Devahasdin na Ayudhya, a close associate of Gen Prawit Wongsuwon, tried to distance the Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) leader from politician Samart Janechaijittawanich, who was arrested on Monday in connection with the high-profile public fraud case linked to The iCon Group.

data.title: Meet to focus on Chiang Mai recovery
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra will hold her first mobile cabinet meeting in Chiang Mai under the theme "From Flood To Flourish", to rehabilitate Chiang Mai following major floods.

data.title: Govt launches fish 'clean-up'
data.description: Thailand has launched an integrated effort to tackle the invasion of  blackchin tilapia , targeting the removal of three million kilogrammes of the invasive species from the ecosystem under an urgent "Big Cleaning" campaign.

data.title: Legal issues threaten maid's claim to late employer's estate
data.description: Nutwalai Pupongta, the trusted housemaid of a French businesswoman who committed suicide in Koh Samui on April 29, might not be able to inherit 100 million baht in assets from her former employer as police have found the deceased illegally ran businesses and owned luxury villas via nominees.

data.title: Govt plans a 'Grand' travel year
data.description: The government is gearing up for its "Amazing Thailand Grand Tourism and Sports Year 2025", with events and special privileges planned to attract more visitors.

data.title: Airports of Thailand to pay B12b due to noise pollution from new runway
data.description: Airports of Thailand (AoT) plans to issue 12 billion baht in compensation to residents impacted by noise pollution from the third and newest runway at Suvarnabhumi Airport.

data.title: Airports of Thailand to pay B12b due to noise pollution from new runway
data.description: Airports of Thailand (AoT) plans to issue 12 billion baht in compensation to residents impacted by noise pollution from the third and newest runway at Suvarnabhumi Airport.

data.title: Woman's serial cyanide cases expand to 14 more victims
data.description: Prosecutors will be appointed to review 14 additional cases filed against Sararat “Aem Cyanide” Rangsiwuthaporn, who allegedly poisoned and killed her victims with  cyanide , said Department of Criminal Litigation Director-General Sanjai Chanphong on Tuesday.

data.title: B2m fake cosmetics seized in Thai province of Khon Kaen
data.description: The Consumer Protection Police Division (CCPD) seized  over 40,000 items , worth about 2 million baht, in a raid at an  illegal cosmetics factory  in Khon Kaen on Monday.

data.title: Monks under probe for keeping 73 corpses in Thailand's Phichit province
data.description: Officials are investigating  monks  supervising two connected Buddhist places in the northern province of Phichit, where 73  corpses  were stored without permission.

data.title: Malaysia to deploy elite force on Thai border to combat crime
data.description: Malaysia  will assign a special force to take the lead in guarding the  border  with Narathiwat

data.title: Arrested politician Samart denies money-laundering with iCon Group
data.description: Politician Samart Janechaijittawanich denied laundering money in relation to millions of baht he received from The iCon Group, the direct sales company being prosecuted for alleged public fraud, saying the sums were loans and donations, according to the Department of Special Investigation (DSI).

data.title: Activist seeks court action on Thai-Cambodia MoU deal
data.description: The Ombudsman has been asked to petition the Constitutional Court to rule whether a 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) on joint development in the Gulf of Thailand signed by Thailand and Cambodia breaches the constitution.

data.title: Four dead, girl seriously injured in Samut Prakan shooting spree
data.description: SAMUT PRAKAN: Four people died and a girl was severely wounded when a man opened fire at a neighbouring family and then took his own life.

data.title: Heavy rain to hit southern Thailand
data.description: The Meteorological Department warned residents of Chumphon, Surat Thani, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Phatthalung, Songkhla, Pattani, Yala and Narathiwat to brace for heavy showers, which are forecast to hit the South until Nov 30.

data.title: Transport ministry pushes flood mitigation in northern Thailand
data.description: The Transport Ministry will present a comprehensive flood-mitigation plan for Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai at a mobile cabinet meeting in Chiang Mai on Friday, according to Transport Permanent Secretary Chayatan Phromsorn on Monday.

data.title: Ministers summoned over Khao Kradong land dispute
data.description: The House committee on land, natural resources and the environment has summoned the interior and transport ministers to provide more information on the Khao Kradong land controversy on Wednesday.

data.title: Thaksin 'key factor' in Udon Thani local election win
data.description: The ruling Pheu Thai Party believes former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra played a key role in helping its candidate secure victory in the provincial administrative organisation (PAO) chairman election in Udon Thani.

data.title: Govt keen to downplay Thai-Cambodian sea spat
data.description: The government expressed confidence on Monday that the 2001 memorandum of understanding on joint development in the Gulf of Thailand  signed by Thailand and Cambodia  would not trigger mass protests.

data.title: Heavy rain to hit the South
data.description: The Meteorological Department warned residents of Chumphon, Surat Thani, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Phatthalung, Songkhla, Pattani, Yala and Narathiwat to brace for heavy showers, which are forecast to hit the South until Nov 30.

data.title: Activist seeks court action on MoU deal
data.description: The Ombudsman has been asked to petition the Constitutional Court to rule whether a 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) on joint development in the Gulf of Thailand signed by Thailand and Cambodia breaches the constitution.

data.title: PM urges action to protect women, kids from abuse
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra on Monday urged the public to support government efforts to end violence against children and women.

data.title: Transport ministry pushes North flood mitigation
data.description: The Transport Ministry will present a comprehensive flood-mitigation plan for Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai at a mobile cabinet meeting in Chiang Mai on Friday, according to Transport Permanent Secretary Chayatan Phromsorn on Monday.

data.title: Phuket steps up for  carbon-free tourism
data.description: Phuket took a significant step toward sustainable tourism with the launch of the "Phuket Old Town Carbon Neutrality 2030" initiative, aimed at making the historic old town the first carbon-neutral area in Thailand by 2030.

data.title: Ministers summoned over Khao Kradong dispute
data.description: The House committee on land, natural resources and the environment has summoned the interior and transport ministers to provide more information on the Khao Kradong land controversy on Wednesday.

data.title: Thaksin 'key factor' in Udon Thani win
data.description: The ruling Pheu Thai Party believes former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra played a key role in helping its candidate secure victory in the provincial administrative organisation (PAO) chairman election in Udon Thani.

data.title: Govt keen to downplay sea spat
data.description: The government expressed confidence on Monday that the 2001 memorandum of understanding on joint development in the Gulf of Thailand signed by Thailand and Cambodia would not trigger mass protests.

data.title: Thai politician Samart arrested over iCon Group fraud case
data.description: Police arrested politician  Samart Janechaijittawanich  in the northernmost province of Chiang Rai on Monday after he was wanted for alleged  money laundering  in connection with  The iCon Group  fraud case.

data.title: Foreigners flee Myanmar scam gang into Thailand's Mae Sot
data.description: TAK: Thirty-nine foreign nationals who claimed to be victims of a  call centre gang  were  rescued  Monday morning by Thai authorities during a border patrol operation.

data.title: Foreigners flee scam gang
data.description: TAK: Thirty-nine foreign nationals who claimed to be victims of a call centre gang were rescued Monday morning by Thai authorities during a border patrol operation.

data.title: Compensation planned for buildings affected by new Suvarnabhumi runway
data.description: Airports of Thailand Plc is planning to issue  compensation  to owners of houses and other buildings to be impacted by the opening of a  new runway  at Suvarnabhumi Airport slated for early next year.

data.title: Thai politician Samart wanted over iCon Group fraud case
data.description: The Criminal Court issued a warrant for the arrest of politician Samart Janechaijittawanich for alleged money-laundering in connection with The iCon Group fraud case.

data.title: Thai politician Samart arrested over iCon Group fraud case
data.description: Police arrested politician  Samart Janechaijittawanich  in the northernmost province of Chiang Rai on Monday after he was wanted for alleged  money laundering  in connection with  The iCon Group  fraud case.

data.title: Thai ministry saddened as tainted Laos moonshine claims another life
data.description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs has expressed its condolences after a second Australian teen transferred from Laos to be treated for methanol poisoning after drinking tainted liquor, died on Sunday.

data.title: Chinese man rescued after 3 days down dry well in Mae Sot
data.description: A  Chinese man  was rescued from a 12-metre  dry water well  on Sunday night, three days after he accidentally fell into it and became trapped.

data.title: Thaksin thanks Udon voters for saving him from embarrassment
data.description: Former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra congratulated Sarawut Pethpanomporn on Sunday night for winning the provincial administrative organisation chairman election in Udon Thani and hoped the momentum would continue until a new general poll.

data.title: Boy, 12, praised for rescuing drowning girl, 17, in Bangkok
data.description: A 12-year-old boy received public praise for rescuing a 17-year-old girl who jumped into the Chao Phraya River from a Bangkok bridge on Friday night.

data.title: Politician wanted for The iCon Group fraud case
data.description: The Criminal Court issued a warrant for the arrest of politician Samart Janechaijittawanich for alleged money-laundering in connection with The iCon Group fraud case.
